title: Project-Based Education for Internet Risk Prevention: Safety.EDU

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners develop internet risk prevention strategies by performing projects using smart devices and conducting mathematical analyses.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and classify eight types of internet risks (cyberbullying, overdependence, gaming addiction, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can mathematically model risk prevention strategies through project-based activities and present results using data visualization tools.
After analyzing risk scenarios, learners can develop prevention solutions in teams and validate practical applicability using at least three evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
